jobPostingInfo.title: Enterprise Systems Analyst II -  Product Lifecycle Management
jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Job Details

New ideas are all around us, but only a few will change the world. That’s our focus at JPL. We ask the biggest questions, then search the universe for answers—literally. We build upon ideas that have guided generations, then share our discoveries to inspire generations to come. Your mission—your opportunity—is to seek out the answers that bring us one step closer. If you’re driven to discover, create, and inspire something that lasts a lifetime and beyond, you’re ready for JPL.

Located in Pasadena, California, JPL has a campus-like environment situated on 177 acres in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains and offers a work environment unlike any other: we inspire passion, foster innovation, build collaboration, and reward excellence.

Responsibilities:

PLM Enterprise System Analyst opportunity working with Product Lifecycle Management Enterprise System Analysis Group reporting to the Group Supervisor.  You will provide technical, functional and engineering support for JPL specific Oracle Application Development Framework (ADF) Self Service Applications (SSAs) and other related technologies including Product Life Cycle Management commercial off-the-shelf products. You will partner and receive direction from the line management, product leads, and sponsors responsible for the SSAs.

Will:

  • Have responsibility for major phases of the lifecycle of a highly complex enterprise system such as Oracle, SAP, Peoplesoft, or Teamcenter and related commercial off-the-shelf products.  
  • Gather complex requirements, analyzes, plans, designs, configures, tests, deploys, rolls out and maintains highly complex enterprise software. 
  • Partner with the appointed liaison to the customer/sponsor throughout the entire life cycle of the product. 
  • Interact with customer and/or sponsor to resolve complex issues. 
  • Partner with customers to capture complex requirements for enterprise applications.
  • Analyze and use diagramming tools to represent complex processes.  Validates requirements. Evaluates modules of complex new or existing enterprise information software or stand alone applications to align with institutional practices. Conducts analysis on the design of software solutions that meet requirements.
  • Partner with other analysts to modify set up and/or configures highly complex software that integrates with the enterprise suite of applications and/or stand alone applications.
  • Develop complex integrated test, data conversion and system implementation plans.
  • Perform complex data validation and unit/module tests.  Partners with other analysts in system integration testing.
  • Evaluate and validate complex test results.
  • Apply broad knowledge in field to create software documentation.
  • Use basic understanding of architectural requirements when designing enterprise solutions.

Qualifications:

  • Typically requires a Bachelor's degree in Information Science, Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related a discipline and a minimum of 3 or more years of related practical experience; or a Master's degree with 1 year experience or a PhD in similar disciplines with a minimum of 0 years related experience. 
  • Broad knowledge in one or more of the following areas: Product Lifecycle Management (PLM), Software Project Management, Oracle E-Business Suite, Custom Software Support, System Configuration Management, Implementation/Support, and Business Process Analysis Expertise. 
  • Understanding and wide application of advanced principles, theories, concepts and techniques in: Project Management, Data Management, Requirements Gathering, User Acceptance, Software Quality Assurance, Software Implementation, and User/Customer Support.
  • Broad working experience and capability of managing applications including hardware/software architecture, planning, configuration, deployment, implementation, technical support, and operations of Software Applications. Plus, ability of providing functional and technical deliverables such as, requirements, training material, helpdesk documents, test cases and test scripts.
  • Previous experience should include the ability to effectively interface with users providing training and technical support. Plus, must have experience working on dynamic teams composed of product leads, project managers, system engineers, solution architects, developers, and operations. 
  • Excellent communication skills, written and verbal, must be capable of effectively capturing and transferring technical and functional information at all JPL level’s. Must have the ability to develop and conduct product demos, user workshops, joint design sessions, training, and user acceptance sessions. 
  • Good leadership skills, capable of guiding, directing and training, software developers, system administrators, system engineers, software quality assurance, other enterprise system analyst, functional users and management. 

Preferred Skills:

  • Experienced at project management and team leadership. 
  • Experienced at requirements gathering, design, development and gap analysis with a proven track record of Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) application delivery.
  • Working knowledge of the institutional applications, including hands on experience leading application development and integration projects specific to JPL’s Oracle E-Business modules and/or PLM applications. 
  • Capable of managing team task and requirements in JIRA. 
  • Reporting and data analysis. 
  • Experience in providing System Engineering Support for the development of requirements specifically for an Oracle Application Development Framework Self Service Application.
  • Experience collaborating with ADF developers to provide the necessary requirements and instructions in the development and successfully delivery of an ADF SSA to operations.
  • Experience coordinating and directing user acceptance testing for an ADF SSA.
  • Experience developing and providing user training for an ADF SSA. 
  • An understanding of the SOA Suite and ADF development.  

JPL has a catalog of benefits and perks that span from the traditional to the unique. This includes a variety of health, dental, vision, wellbeing, and retirement plans, paid time off, learning, rideshare, childcare, flexible schedule, parental leave and many more. Our focus is on work-life balance, and living healthy, fulfilling lives as we Dare Mighty Things Together. For benefits eligible positions, benefits are effective the first day of the month coincident with or immediately following the employee’s start date.

For further benefits information click Benefits and Perks
